speaker:
FIRST
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: Here, neighbor Horner, I drink to you

speaker:
FIRST
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: in a cup of sack; and fear not, neighbor, you shall

speaker:
FIRST
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: do well enough.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: And here, neighbor, here’s a cup of

speaker:
SECOND
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: charneco.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: And here’s a pot of good double beer,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              NEIGHBOR
text: neighbor. Drink, and fear not your man.

speaker: HORNER
text: Let it come, i’ faith, and I’ll pledge you all.

speaker: HORNER
text: And a fig for Peter!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PRENTICE
text: Here, Peter, I drink to thee, and be not

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PRENTICE
text: afraid.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PRENTICE
text: Be merry, Peter, and fear not thy

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PRENTICE
text: master. Fight for credit of the prentices.

speaker: PETER
text: I thank you all. Drink, and pray for me, I pray

speaker: PETER
text: you, for I think I have taken my last draft in this

speaker: PETER
text: world. Here, Robin, an if I die, I give thee my

speaker: PETER
text: apron.—And, Will, thou shalt have my hammer.—

speaker: PETER
text: And here, Tom, take all the money that I have.

speaker: PETER
text: O Lord, bless me, I

speaker: PETER
text: pray God, for I am never able to deal with my

speaker: PETER
text: master. He hath learnt so much fence already.

speaker: SALISBURY
text: Come, leave your drinking, and fall to

speaker: SALISBURY
text: blows. Sirrah, what’s thy name?

speaker: PETER
text: Peter, forsooth.

speaker: SALISBURY
text: Peter? What more?

speaker: PETER
text: Thump.

speaker: SALISBURY
text: Thump? Then see thou thump thy master

speaker: SALISBURY
text: well.

speaker: HORNER
text: Masters, I am come hither, as it were, upon

speaker: HORNER
text: my man’s instigation, to prove him a knave and

speaker: HORNER
text: myself an honest man; and touching the Duke of

speaker: HORNER
text: York, I will take my death I never meant him any

speaker: HORNER
text: ill, nor the King, nor the Queen.—And therefore,

speaker: HORNER
text: Peter, have at thee with a downright blow!

speaker: YORK
text: Dispatch. This knave’s tongue begins to double.

speaker: YORK
text: Sound, trumpets. Alarum to the combatants!

speaker: HORNER
text: Hold, Peter, hold! I confess, I confess treason.

speaker: YORK
text: Take away his weapon.—Fellow, thank God and

speaker: YORK
text: the good wine in thy master’s way.

speaker: PETER
text: O God, have I overcome mine enemies in this

speaker: PETER
text: presence? O Peter, thou hast prevailed in right!

KING
